ORDER SETTING SCHEDULING CONFERENCE: Counsel are hereby notified that a Scheduling Conference has been set for Monday, April 10, 2006 at 8:30 a.m. before District Judge S. James Otero in Courtroom 1600, 312 North Spring Street, Los Angeles, California 90012. Counsel are directed to comply with Rule 26(f) of the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure in a timely fashion and to file a Joint Rule 26(f) report on or before March 27, 2006. MINUTES: The court is in receipt of the lodged "Stipulation and Proposed Order for Dismissal as to the Entire Action Pursuant to FRCP 41(a)(1). The court DENIES the lodged stipulation without prejudice to refile a second stipulation consistent with this order. Judge S. James Otero :Court Reporter: Not present. (bp, ) (Entered: 08/14/2006)

STIPULATION AND ORDER that this action is to be dismissed with prejudice as to defendant Castle Hill Apparel, Inc., This action is to be dismissed without prejudice as to Daffy's, Inc., Mervyn's LLC., The TJX Companies, Inc., T.J. Maxx of California, LLC, Bang Bang Boutiques, LLC, Miki Manufacturing of California, Federated Department Stores, Inc., Macy's Northwest, individually, and doing business as Bon Marche, Burlington Coat Factory Warehouse Corp., individually, and doing business as Cohoe's, Express Male, Inc., Harwell Enterprises, Ltd, The Junkman's Daughter, Inc., Marine Corp. Exchange, Portland MDSE, Inc., Worldwide Distribution and all Doe defendants. Each party is to bear its own costs and fees by Judge S. James Otero :, (Made JS-6. Case Terminated.)(bp, ) (Entered: 08/29/2006)
